etymology.description: 预(advance; beforehand) + 订(set; order) = arrange/confirm in advance (reserve; book)
etymology.interpretation: Combines doing something ahead of time with formally setting or ordering it. Emphasizes confirming a service or item before the time of use.
etymology.simplification: 預 → 预 drops the 頁 component, retaining phonetic 予 to reduce strokes; 訂 → 订 simplifies 言 to 讠 while keeping 丁, streamlining writing.

parts.english: in advance; beforehand; to anticipate; to prepare
to order; to subscribe; to agree; to fix

examples.chinese: 我想预订一张两人桌(我想預訂一張兩人桌)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng yùdìng yì zhāng liǎng rén zhuō.
examples.english: I want to reserve a table for two.

examples.chinese: 我们提前在网上预订了酒店(我們提前在網上預訂了酒店)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen tíqián zài wǎngshàng yùdìng le jiǔdiàn.
examples.english: We booked the hotel online in advance.

examples.chinese: 餐厅要求预订需提供姓名和电话(餐廳要求預訂需提供姓名和電話)。
examples.pinyin: Cāntīng yāoqiú yùdìng xū tígōng xìngmíng hé diànhuà.
examples.english: The restaurant requires a name and phone number for reservations.
